channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Danish Police Investigate Two Explosions Near the Israeli Embassy
item.description: The authorities said they were investigating after the explosions were heard early Wednesday morning near Copenhagen. Nobody was injured.

item.title: ‘Nothing Left to Lose’: Britain’s Conservatives Are Surprisingly Upbeat
item.description: At its annual convention in Birmingham, the party is energized by a leadership contest and seems largely undisturbed by broader questions over its ele...

item.title: Israel’s Lebanon Invasion Leaves Christian Village Uprooted
item.description: Hundreds of residents of tiny Ain Ebel in southern Lebanon heeded the Israeli military’s warning to flee. Many sought shelter in a nearby monastery.

item.title: Laborer From Gaza Is First Reported Fatality of Iran’s Missile Attack
item.description: Sameh al-Asali, who was sheltering in the city of Jericho in the Israeli-occupied West Bank, was killed when a large missile fragment slammed into him...

item.title: Longtime China bull Ray Dalio says Beijing now has to chose between ‘beautiful deleveraging’ and economic malaise
item.description: Billionaire investor Dalio says Beijing’s ‘big week’ of stimulus could be one for the history books

item.title: How to make smart Medicare Open Enrollment choices for 2025
item.description: “It's going to be challenging,” says expert Philip Moeller, who urges people to take their time.

item.title: On the economy, Harris and Trump are making the same mistake
item.description: Harris and Trump are trying to reshape investment and redistribute income and economic activity to their favored sectors.

item.title: Hurricane Helene shuts down critical mines, endangering AI chip supply
item.description: The two mines provide high-purity quartz for semiconductors.

item.title: This Is Why MAGA Loves JD Vance
item.description: Trump’s running mate is no Mike Pence.

item.title: Bill Gates is open to losing $101 billion to the tax man—but not policies that replicate North Korea’s ‘unbelievable equality’
item.description: Gates said he would support a tax policy which took away 62% of his fortune—worth $101 billion.

item.title: Tel Aviv Shooting Leaves Six Dead and Several Injured

item.title: Israel Vows Retaliation Against Iran, and Takeaways From the Debate
Police See No Trace of a Serial Killer in Brooklyn. But 3 Deaths Chill Nightlife.
item.description: As rumors spin on social media, revelers in one of New York City’s most popular neighborhoods for nightlife are on higher alert.
